newsitem.title: USA: Midwest Express weighs adding a third hub.
newsitem.headline: Midwest Express weighs adding a third hub.

text.p: Midwest Express Holdings Inc, a passenger jet service catering to business travelers, said it plans to add a third operation base between 1998 and 2000.
The airline now serves certain business destinations from its base operations in Milwaukee and Omaha.

Speaking at the Dillon Read Airlines, Aviation Services and Logistics Conference, Midwest Express Chairman Timothy Hoeksema said the airline will select an underserved market with a high population of business travelers for its third hub.
The airline will begin non-stop service between Kansas City and New York on May 1.
Hoeksema said Kansas City "was on the list of possibilities" for the third base, but a decision had not yet been made.
